I can actually get the exception by just opening this file:

---

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<%@page contentType="text/xml; charset=ISO-8859-1" %>

<list>
	<item></item>
</list>

---

it also looks like the document is partitioned as HTML_DEFAULT instead of
XML_DEFAULT, so content type is not getting initialized properly?

Phil .. back to you ... I checked in some changes that prevent the NPE from 
happening, but do not think all is getting re-configured correctly yet. 

Not sure if model/facotries/adapters need more "reinit" or if just the editor does?

Please investigate and let me know what you find.

This should be fixed by 0.7.

We might try utilizing ContentTypeDefinition to get embeddedContentType and
language for a JSP (in the JSPModelLoader) before parsing it.

Should be fixed with bug 101556.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 101556 ***
